instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message:
Hello guys, 

I have a imac 21.5 2012 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) with some weird issues, i will try to do my best to explain clearly (btw sorry in advance for my terrible english).
First, L9100 has blow up, i think because of the lcd cable that wasn't properly pluged (shorted, changed him).

I replaced L9100 but then, the fan was always at full speed enabled even if the imac was turn off. I read on the board that <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> was probably the problem, i changed it and after the imac was ok.

I didn't used it only one day, i tried to turn him on but nothing, only led 1, i changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> (<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> not new) again and he managed to turn on, but after that, dead again, same thing, again after 1 day that i didn't used it. 

Since, i again changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> by another one but it never turned on again. Tried even a brand new <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> but nothing, only led 1.

So i tried to change <CHIP>U7950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7870</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> (all are news), <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> have a weird voltage, <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7870</CHIP> too :

<CHIP>U7950</CHIP> :

Pin 1 = 12.16v
Pin 2 = 3.3v
Pin 3/4 = 0V
Pin 5 = 12.16v
Pin 6 = 19.20v
Pin 7 = 12.16v
Pin 8 = 12.00V

<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>:

Pin 1, 2, 4, 8 = 12.16v
Pin 3, 5, 6 = 12.16v

<CHIP>U7870</CHIP>: 

All good except 
pin 7 = 19.22v
pin 8 = 3.8v

<TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR>:

All good exept
Pin 4 = 19.22v

I also noticed that <CHIP>U5300</CHIP> have pin 6 17v.

Big thanks in advance for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Keep in mind, N-channel MOSFET requires positive voltage between G and S to get ON.
Vgs=10-12V is normal value.
In your case, 7V (19.22-12.16) is a bit low; the MOSFET can overheat and die too soon.
I usually found 20-23V at Gate of these MOSFETs.

Please, count the pins correctly!
Pin 6 of <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> and 3, 5, 6 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> are tied togeteher, check schematic.
You've mixed pins 6 & 7 of <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> probably.

If you get stable LED501, <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> is present and U/<TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> work both.

"I also noticed that <CHIP>U5300</CHIP> have pin 6 17v."
This is absolutely abnormal; please use another multimeter.
Be sure to get correct readings...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78078, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Thank you !

Keep in mind, N-channel MOSFET requires positive voltage between G and S to get ON.
Vgs=10-12V is normal value.
In your case, 7V (19.22-12.16) is a bit low; the MOSFET can overheat and die too soon.
I usually found 20-23V at Gate of these MOSFETs.

[B]Very interesting, thanks for the advice. I bought these mosfets on aliexpress, very hard to find these days.[/B]

Please, count the pins correctly!
Pin 6 of <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> and 3, 5, 6 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> are tied togeteher, check schematic.
You've mixed pins 6 & 7 of <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> probably.

[B]My multimeter is automatic, maybe it not work properly, i will check again.[/B]

If you get stable LED501, <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> is present and U/<TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> work both.

[B]So what can i check next ?[/B]

"I also noticed that <CHIP>U5300</CHIP> have pin 6 17v."
This is absolutely abnormal; please use another multimeter.
Be sure to get correct readings...

[B]OK i will check that too.[/B]
[/QUOTE]

Thanks for your quick answer !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message:
So i checked again with another multimeter :

<CHIP>U5300</CHIP> :
pin 6 = 0V

<CHIP>U7870</CHIP> :
pin 1 = 3.40V
pin 2 = 12.11V
pin 5 = 12.11V
pin 6 = 12.11V
pin 7 =  19.32V
pin 8 = 3.82V

<TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> :
pin 1 2 3 = 12.16V
pin 4 = 19.20V
pin 5 6 7 8 = 12.16V

<CHIP>U7950</CHIP> :
pin 1 = 12.11V
pin 2 = 3.31V
pin 3 4 = 0V
pin 5 = 12.11V
pin 6 7 8 = 0V

<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> : 
 pin 1 2 7 8 = 12.16V
pin 3 5 6 = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message:
No need to check again Q/<CHIP>U7870</CHIP>, I already explained why.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> will get on when board turns on.
<CHIP>U7950</CHIP> should get 3V at pin 2 only then, and sends out 20V at pin 6.
Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>12V_S0_FET</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message: When you say <SIGNAL>12V_S0_FET</SIGNAL>, you mean pin 7 <CHIP>U7950</CHIP>? If so, i have 225. Sorry,  i'm quite novice in mac.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on, only first led
threads.message:
3V at pin 2 of <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> for sure?
If yes, change <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure to solder them correctly.
